result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davontae Tyrone Staten

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Davontae Tyrone Staten appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Davontae Tyrone Staten.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Davontae Tyrone Staten not in court, in custody. Attorney Tom Harris in Court for the Defendant via Zoom. Prosecuting attorney John J Rejowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in Court for State V Lee hearing. Public Defender's office just appointed Attorney Tom Harris. Case needs to be set for prelim. Court finds good cause to extend the deadline for the preliminary hearing. Case set on prelim calendar.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Davontae Tyrone Staten

Prior: 1838 North 26th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205

Defendant Davontae Tyrone Staten not in court, in custody in HOC.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Davontae Tyrone Staten not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State request a State V-Lee hearing or Status, Court denied request.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered and oral no contact order B.O.H, J.A.H., D.A.T.
State is to submit a written no contact order at the next date.

Defendant Davontae Tyrone Staten in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Davontae Tyrone Staten in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
